ktbyte.gui

Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • ktbyte.gui.Console

  • public class Console
extends java.lang.Object
    This GUI element acts as a Command-line interface, accepting user input and handling custom responses.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Console(PApplet pap, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      This constructs a new Console object within the current context (PApplet), starting from the x and y coordinates, having a given width and height

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw()
      This is a register method and should not be called directly
      java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a stored value from the console's memory
      void mouseEvent(MouseEvent e)
      This is a register method and should not be called directly
      void readInput(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name of the next console's entry
      void setConsoleInputListener(ConsoleInputListener consoleInputListener)
      Sets the input listener of the console
      void setInputTextColor(int inputTextColor)
      Sets the color of the input text
      void setOutputTextColor(int outputTextColor)
      Sets the color of the output text
      void setTextSize(int textSize)
      Sets the size of the text
      void write(java.lang.String text)
      Outputs text in the console

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
